con.para: A force is a push or pull on an object. It can make things move, stop, or change direction!
Forces can make things move faster, slower, or change their direction. Without forces, nothing would move!
There are different types of forces like gravity, friction, and magnetism. Each one acts differently on objects.
Gravity pulls everything down to the Earth. It’s the reason why we stay on the ground and why things fall when you drop them!

con.title: Friction – The Force That Slows Things Down

con.para: Friction happens when two surfaces rub against each other. It stops things from sliding forever.
Things want to keep doing what they’re already doing. This is called inertia. If something is still, it stays still until a force moves it. If it’s moving, it keeps moving until a force stops it!
The more force you use, the faster an object will move! But the heavier it is, the harder it is to move.
For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction! If you push something, it pushes back with the same force.

con.title: Examples of Forces in Everyday Life

con.para: From riding a bike to playing on a swing, forces are all around us! Can you think of other examples where forces are at work?
